channel.title: Pendant Productions - Seminar: An original anthology show
channel.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
channel.itunes:subtitle: Seminar: An original anthology show
channel.itunes:summary: Seminar is an original radio drama anthology show spanning every genre and style with one new episode every month!
channel.itunes:keywords: radio drama, OTR, old time radio, anthology, sci-fi, science fiction, twilight zone

item.title: Episode Forty-five
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Forty-five - Sonny discovers what it is to be a "Sample" and Lauren relives her "Rebellion"!

item.title: Episode Forty-five COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Colin Kelly and writer Patrick Lewis with live commentary on Seminar episode 45

item.title: Episode Forty-four
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Forty-four - The survival of the human race hangs in the balance of a "Vocabulary Test" and Alex finds direction "In the Sun".

item.title: Episode Forty-four COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Colin Kelly and writer Anna Rodriguez with live commentary on Seminar episode 44

item.title: Episode Forty-three
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Forty-three - Law and justice wrestle as bullets fly!

item.title: Episode Forty-three COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Colin Kelly and writer Frank Harbuck III with live commentary on Seminar episode 43

item.title: Episode Forty-two
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Forty-two - Humans and otherworldly forces clash as desire exacts its price! Featuring "Lucky You" and "You Gave Me Nothing".

item.title: Episode Forty-two COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Directors Jeffrey Bridges and Colin Kelly with live commentary on Seminar episode 42

item.title: Episode Forty-one
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Forty-one - An accountant and a barber explore evil as the hunt heightens at the school! Featuring "The Burrower" and "Barbershop Trio".

item.title: Episode Forty-one COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Jeffrey Bridges, assistant director Colin Kelly, assistant director Bruce Busby and writers Perry Whittle and Mike Murphy with live commentary on Seminar episode 41

item.title: Episode Forty
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Forty - Fate attacks, free will is ignored and trouble intensifies at the school! Featuring "Pterosaurs and Fighter Planes" and "Why You Pick Up Your Socks"

item.title: Episode Forty COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Jeffrey Bridges and writers Joshua W. Miller and Jack Calk with live commentary on Seminar episode 40

item.title: Episode Thirty-nine
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Thirty-nine - A starlet and an ancient curse attack while the students explore individuality! Featuring "Getting What You Want" and "Blocks".

item.title: Episode Thirty-eight
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Thirty-eight - Chaos advances and balance demands sacrifice! Featuring "The End of a Beginning" and "No".

item.title: Episode Thirty-eight COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director and writer Michael Bergonzi and writer Christopher Stadther with live commentary on Seminar episode 38

item.title: Episode Thirty-seven
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Thirty-seven - Join us as loss and memory are wrestled with and put to bed. Featuring "Bed 667" and "Memories in the Dark".

item.title: Episode Thirty-seven COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Michael Bergonzi and writers Kateryna Fury and Anna Rodriguez with live commentary on Seminar episode 37

item.title: Episode Thirty-six
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Thirty-six - Join a scientist and doctor as they have first contact and final battles! Featuring "The Scientific Method" and "Time's Quartet, part 4 - End Game".

item.title: Episode Thirty-six COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie, assistant director Michael Bergonzi and writer Brian M Oldham with live commentary on Seminar episode 36

item.title: Episode Thirty-five
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Thirty-five - Love and lust collide as gods play games and humans fight! Featuring "Coffeshop of Love" and "Henpecked".

item.title: Episode Thirty-five COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and writers Colin Kelly and Kim Gianopoulos with live commentary on Seminar episode 35

item.title: Episode Thirty-four
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Thirty-four - A simple man and a soldier take control of their lives...after they've died! Featuring "The Damned" and "Screen Door".

item.title: Episode Thirty-four COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and writers Colin Snow and Jeffrey Bridges with live commentary on Seminar episode 34

item.title: Episode Thirty-three
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Thirty-three - The real and fantastic collide as police investigate a murder on a horror movie set!

item.title: Episode Thirty-three COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and writers Brendan Peterson and Perry Whittle with live commentary on Seminar episode 33

item.title: Episode Thirty-two
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Thirty-two - Lives are rocked in a moment as strangers collide in a subway and skyscraper!

item.title: Episode Thirty-two COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and writers Marleigh Norton and Jack Calk with live commentary on Seminar episode 32

item.title: Episode Thirty-one
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Thirty-one - As mundane and fantastic events collide with their lives, two ordinary office workers deal with the remains!

item.title: Episode Thirty-one COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and writers Jack Calk and M Sieiro Garcia with live commentary on Seminar episode 31

item.title: Episode Thirty
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Thirty - Tune in, as our hosts face fireballs and poison apples in a game of ratings and psychosis! Featuring "Wanda's Wonderful Wizard World" and "Scrappin' with Amber and Tammy".

item.title: Episode Thirty COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and writers Perry Whittle and Susan Fairhurst with live commentary on Seminar episode 30

item.title: Episode Twenty-nine
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Twenty-nine - A phone call and a paint ball game hold unexpected conversations and consequences for two men. Featuring "Mount Citheron" and "Error".

item.title: Episode Twenty-nine COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and writer Colin J. Kelly with live commentary on Seminar episode 29

item.title: Episode Twenty-eight
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Twenty-eight - A loud-mouthed caveman attempts to save the future with comic and disastrous results. Featuring "The Brontosaurus Effect".

item.title: Episode Twenty-eight COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and writer Jovian Lab with live commentary on Seminar episode 28

item.title: Episode Twenty-seven
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Twenty-seven - Ken and Tony score and foul in a big league game of... journalism. Featuring "Reading Between the Lines".

item.title: Episode Twenty-six
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Twenty-six - Party with the undead and gamble with a god. Join us as we raise the stakes in love and conflict. Featuring "Dracula Sucks! part 2" and "Time's Quartet part 3 - Counter Point".

item.title: Episode Twenty-six COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and writers Frank Harbuck III and Brian M Oldham with live commentary on Seminar episode 26

item.title: Episode Twenty-five
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Twenty-five - Tea and root beer floats are on the menu, as a secret sisterhood plans world domination and federal agents fight an ancient brotherhood. Featuring "Time's Quartet part 2 - Opening" and "Tea and Terrorism".

item.title: Episode Twenty-five COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and writers Brian M Oldham and Marleigh Norton with live commentary on Seminar episode 25

item.title: Episode Twenty-four
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Twenty-four - A drive home and a day at work challenge modern people, as they confront old souls.

item.title: Episode Twenty-four COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie, and writer Brian M Oldham with live commentary on Seminar episode 24

item.title: Episode Twenty-three
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Twenty-three - Journey with shipwrecked pirates and a real estate lawyer, as they encounter the comic side of the unreal.

item.title: Episode Twenty-three COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie, and writers Frank Harbuck III and Brian M Oldham with live commentary on Seminar episode 23

item.title: Episode Twenty-two
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Twenty-two - Christmas forces a lonely woman and a frustrated adolescent to struggle with loss, family, and the future.

item.title: Episode Twenty-two COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie, and writers Jovian Lab and Mike Winters with live commentary on Seminar episode 22

item.title: Episode Twenty-one
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Twenty-one - We all hunger. Join us as food is used to explore two very different appetites.

item.title: Episode Twenty-one COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and writer Kristy Plotkin with live commentary on Seminar episode 21

item.title: Episode Twenty
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Twenty - What kind of scenes do friends, lovers, and strangers play out with each other as they share, hide, and lie with their words?

item.title: Episode Twenty COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and Co-Creator Kathryn Pryde with live commentary on Seminar episode 20

item.title: Episode Nineteen
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Nineteen - Jacob and Clint both reach the end of the line, with drastically different results. Sometimes the help of a friend (or lack thereof) can make you... or break you.

item.title: Episode Nineteen COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Marrcus Beattie and Assistant Director Kathryn Pryde with live commentary on Seminar episode 19

item.title: Episode Eighteen
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Eighteen - Rev up the Mystery Machine and say goodbye to old favorites. Children's shows aren't just for kids.

item.title: Episode Eighteen COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Kathryn Pryde and Assistant Director Marrcus Beattie with live commentary on Seminar episode 18

item.title: Episode Seventeen
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Seventeen - Forces of nature are not to be trifled with, be they planets or... typewriters.

item.title: Episode Seventeen COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Kathryn Pryde and Assistant Director Marrcus Beattie with live commentary on Seminar episode 17

item.title: Episode Sixteen
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Sixteen - It's madcap madness and mayhem as the surreal Detective Mac reaches its surprising conclusion!

item.title: Episode Sixteen COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Kathryn Pryde with live commentary on Seminar episode 16

item.title: Episode Fifteen
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Fifteen - What do aging, fading rock stars and disgruntled customers have in common? They're both... edible. Featuring "Feed the Poor" and "Third Shift".

item.title: Episode Fourteen
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Fourteen - If you're on the run, you'd better hope your disguise is at least good enough to fool a cabbie. And when given a big assignment at the last possible second and things go wrong... don't worry, because your clients probably know less than you do. Featuring "On the Lam" and "Good Discussion".

item.title: Episode Fourteen COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Kathryn Pryde with live commentary on Seminar episode 14

item.title: Episode Thirteen
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Thirteen - What is the nature of time? Would you rather change the past or concentrate on the future? How you answer that question determines the person you become. Featuring "Timepiece" and "Killing Time".

item.title: Episode Twelve
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Twelve - The macabre, insanity and what lies beyond death haunt our characters and teach them that things aren't always what they seem. Featuring "A Perfect Circle" and "Foreclosure".

item.title: Episode Twelve COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Kathryn Pryde with live commentary on Seminar episode 12

item.title: Episode Eleven
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Eleven - Michael Bolton makes crooks feel dirty, Yoopers call when you think about them and the Fnork's gonna getcha if you're not careful. The surreal returns. Featuring "Detective Mac", part 3 and "Roxy and the Trashman", act 3.

item.title: Episode Eleven COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Kathryn Pryde and executive producer Jeffrey Bridges with live commentary on Seminar episode 11

item.title: Episode Ten
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Ten - A Russian is assassinated by an American, which makes headaches for the British, and just what happens when you're adrift in space, waiting for rescue? Some things there's no escape from. Featuring "Costigan" and "Escape Pod".

item.title: Episode Ten COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Kathryn Pryde and executive producer Jeffrey Bridges with live commentary on Seminar episode 10

item.title: Episode Nine
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Nine - Cows chew the cud and literary characters mock your sexual prowess, or lack thereof. It's an examination of humor that gives voice to inner desires like... farmhands are hot. And so is Erik. Featuring "Ruminations" and "Don't Come Back Until I Have a Penis".

item.title: Episode Nine COMMENTARY
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Director Kathryn Pryde with live commentary on Seminar episode 9

item.title: Episode Eight
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Eight - The Trashman has a body! And a bathroom. What a guy! And do you have any idea what "Detective Mac" scripts go for on the black market? $300! It's true. Featuring "Roxy and the Trashman", act 2, and "Detective Mac", part 2.

item.title: Episode Seven
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Seven - When looking for work, take jobs from mysterious strangers at your own peril. And sometimes the most horrible thing about a murder is what you don't know. Featuring "Cargo" and "Enmity".

item.title: Episode Six
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Six - When aliens invade, who you gonna call? The sales team, that's who! And just what does Sandy Valentine want with Detective Mac? It must be pretty serious, because dames don't rebuild stairs for just anyone! Featuring "Conference Call" and "Detective Mac".

item.title: Episode Five
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Five - Old friends get together for one last hurrah, but there's always the little problem of ego to get in the way. And be wary of falling down garbage chutes... but should it happen, well, maybe you'll be lucky enough to meet the Trashman. Featuring "The Reunion" and "Roxy and the Trashman".

item.title: Episode Four
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Four - How well does the Instructor understand comedy, or for that matter, warm caffeinated beverages? Spontaneous inquiry: what is humor? Featuring "Black Joe Coffee" and "Coffee Break".

item.title: Episode Three
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Three - The Instructor takes things down a dark road and into a world of murder and violence, double-crosses and abusive booyfriends... and the chance to turn the tables on those who've wronged you. Featuring "Walk with Death" and "Game's Over".

item.title: Episode Two
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode Two - Who is rapping, rapping at the chamber door? A dark and foreboding creature, or a gentle but imaginary friend? Seminar tackles the ways in which we cope with loss and despair... or fail to. Featuring "The Raven" and "Genji".

item.title: Episode One
item.itunes:author: Pendant Productions
item.description: Episode One - What happens when Satan has your phone number, and knows all of your darkest, dirtiest secrets? Whatever it is, it's got to be worse than when your ex-partner in crime gets out of jail and has a plan for one more big score that could set you up for life... or does it? Featuring "The Sound of the Click" and "The Big Payday".
